title: Bird Study
summary: Practice identifying birds, understand behavior and migration, and support conservation in your community.

resources.title: Cornell Lab – All About Birds
resources.description: Field IDs, songs, and range maps.

resources.title: Merlin Bird ID (app)
resources.description: Photo and sound ID in the field.

resources.title: Audubon – Guide to North American Birds
resources.description: Browse by family, habitat, and location.

modules.title: Birding Goals
modules.prompt: Share why you want to study birds and two habitats you plan to explore.

modules.title: Field Observation Log
modules.instructions: Complete at least 3 outings. Log date, location, hours, species observed, and evidence (photo/audio link or description).

modules.title: Build Your Field Guide
modules.instructions: Study five local species. Capture markings, songs, habitat, and distinguishing traits.

modules.title: Behavior & Adaptations
modules.instructions: Use three sources to explain migration or adaptation patterns for two species. Note why they evolved.

modules.title: Conservation Service
modules.instructions: Log 3+ hours helping birds (feeder build, habitat restoration, bird count). Include partners and impact.

quiz.q: Which sense do birds rely on most for migration navigation?
quiz.a: They use a combination of sight, sun position, and Earth’s magnetic field.

quiz.q: True/False: All songbirds migrate south for winter.
Name one way to make windows safer for birds.
quiz.a: Examples: add decals/screens, close blinds, move feeders within 3 feet.
